comment._content: The statues on the Bridge/Phillip St corner of the Colonial Secretary's Office were added over a ca. 6 year period during the 1880s. 'Art', which occupies the upper niche, was the last statue added, on 13/1/1888. 'Science', which occupies the middle niche, was added on 27/10/1883. So this pic was taken some time between those dates. See my comments on the Colonial Secretary's Office statues at - www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/3793507471/ The statue of T.S. Mort in Macquarie Place was unveiled by the NSW Governor, Lord Loftus, on 9/6/1883. Per a couple of digitised newspaper hits, I gather that the New Zealand Loan & Mercantile Agency acquired the Bridge/Loftus St offices and wool stores in ca. April 1884 nla.gov.au/nla.news-article88998884 ...and they appear to have moved in by October 1884 if not earlier...the building had been erected during ?1882/1883 for Trebeck & Son...but they appear to have only occupied it for a short period...here's a description from the Illustrated Sydney News in March 1883...I gather the illustration hasn't been digitised - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article64034445 ; per this March 1883 T&CJ item, the building was then nearing completion - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article71010028 Here's an 1888 Illustrated Sydney News item on the NZ Loan & Mercantile Agency Building...the sketch appears to show a different building next door in Loftus St - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article63620943 The NZL&MA Building also appears in this pic www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/4057365692/ ; and here www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons/6819400210/ ; and also in this ?early 20th century pic acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=53345
